intro: Rhodocolea linearis, commonly known as the slender rhodocolea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several linear leaflets, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds. Rhodocolea linearis is often found in coastal and inland regions, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
